intro: Chiritopsis confertiflora, commonly known as the denseflower chiritopsis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Chiritopsis confertiflora is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
